abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column notes General Motors is betting heavily that it can recapture prestige and swagger of its Cadillac brand, reconstituting it as stand-alone division with new model; Cadillac sales fell 6.5 percent in 2014 from 2013, to 171,000 cars in United States.
lead_paragraph: Cadillac used to be synonymous with American style, quality and prestige. Now, with a new model and a move, General Motors is trying to recapture the swagger.

headline.main: G.M. Bets Big on a Resurgent Cadillac
headline.print_headline: A Bid to Bring Back That Cadillac Swagger

snippet: Cadillac used to be synonymous with American style, quality and prestige. Now, with a new model and a move, General Motors is trying to recapture the swagger.

keywords.value: Cadillac Division of General Motors Corp
keywords.name: organizations
